name: AbdelRahman Abdou
content: AbdelRahman Abdou Toggle navigation AbdelRahman Abdou Home Research Teaching Academics Students All News CISL AbdelRahman Abdou PhD ORCID ID I am an Associate Professor at the School of Computer Science, Carleton University, and co-director of Carleton Internet Security Lab (CISL). In 2018, I was a Senior Research Scientist in the System Security group of ETH ZÃ¼rich, Switzerland. My research interests are network and Internet Security. This includes SDN security, Web security, TLS, DNSSec, authentication, and secure Internet geolocation. I generally use Internet measurements to understand and solve problems related to Internet systems' security. If you are interested in joinging my group, read information under "Prospective Students" on my Students page before contacting me. Golden Gate Bridge, SFO, USA. Oct 28, 2014 Latest News Jun 21, 2025. Our paper, "Formal Security Analysis of ss2DNS", is accepted for publication in ESORICS. Apr 12, 2025. I will be on the PC for IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy (S&P) 2026. Consider submitting. Apr 16, 2023. I will be on the PC for IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy (S&P) 2024. Consider submitting. Jan 27, 2023. Our papers, "Applying Accessibility Metrics to Measure the Threat Landscape for Users with Disabilities" and "Why do Internet Devices Remain Vulnerable? A Survey with System Administrators " are accepted for publication in NDSS Workshop on Measurements, Attacks, and Defenses for the Web (MADWeb). Contacts abdou (at) scs.carleton.ca +1 613-520-2600 ext. 4277 Office: HP5130 Carleton : 1125 Colonel By Drive. Ottawa, ON, Canada K1S 5B6. 2015-24 AbdelRahman Abdou
